page.title: 07Trade in Newborough.
page.content: In the sample of the population surveyed only 30% did their weekly grocery shopping in the nearest supermarket.The rest travelled some two to six miles further.For clothes and household items over 60% shopped in Peterborough,the nearest city centre.Many considered village prices higher than normal for all retail goods. In this age of the plastic credit card and cheque guarantee card it is surprising to find that 81% of the sample actually used cash.This may well be because many of the population are agricultural workers and these employees are still payed weekly in cash. It was hardly surprising to find that the most popular shopping days were Friday and Saturday with Thursday a close third.
